meanings.definition: The ability to perceive sensations such as touch, temperature, and pain.
meanings.sent1: Her aesthesias allowed her to feel the warmth of the sun on her skin.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on aesthesias to understand how patients experience different types of pain.
meanings.sent3: His aesthesias were so sharp, he could tell the exact temperature of the water with just a touch.
meanings.sent4: The artist's aesthesias painted a vivid picture of the world through textures and temperatures.
meanings.sent5: The child's aesthesias were like a superpower, sensing even the slightest changes in their environment.

meanings.definition: The mental recognition and interpretation of sensory stimuli.
meanings.sent1: Through her aesthesias, she could identify the scent of fresh flowers in the air.
meanings.sent2: Aesthesias play a crucial role in how we understand and react to the world around us.
meanings.sent3: His aesthesias were so keen, he could 'hear' colors and 'see' sounds in his mind.
meanings.sent4: In her poetry, she weaved the aesthesias of nature into beautiful verses that touched the soul.
meanings.sent5: The detective's aesthesias were like a puzzle-solving superpower, piecing together sensory clues to crack the case.
